current_task.title: Handle encrypted messages in Chat
current_task.description:
Verify and enhance the Chat.jsx component to properly handle encrypted messages now that E2EE is enabled.

BACKGROUND:
With the full E2EE infrastructure operational:
- B2.2.1: IndexedDBCryptoStore provides persistent key storage
- B2.2.2: initCrypto() initializes crypto in all auth flows
- B2.2.3: Synapse encryption defaults re-enabled
- B2.3.1: Room creation verified E2EE-compatible

Chat messages are now encrypted by default. The Chat component must properly handle decrypted message events.

TASKS:

1. Review Chat.jsx message handling:
   - Verify the timeline listener handles decrypted events correctly
   - Matrix SDK auto-decrypts messages when crypto is initialized
   - Check event type handling (m.room.message vs m.room.encrypted)

2. Add diagnostic logging:
   - Log crypto status when Chat mounts
   - Log message event types received (encrypted vs decrypted)
   - Help diagnose any E2EE message issues

3. Verify sendMessage works with encryption:
   - Matrix SDK auto-encrypts when room has encryption enabled
   - Verify no explicit encryption config needed in sendMessage()
   - Check input clears after successful send

FILES TO REVIEW/MODIFY:
- client/src/components/Chat.jsx

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
1. npm run build --prefix client succeeds
2. Chat.jsx properly receives timeline events (m.room.message after decryption)
3. sendMessage() does not need explicit encryption config (SDK handles it)
4. Diagnostic logging added for crypto status on mount
5. Diagnostic logging added for message event types

last_programmer_output:
Task B2.3.2 completed: Enhanced Chat.jsx to handle encrypted messages with E2EE diagnostic logging.

TASK IMPLEMENTATION:
Added crypto status verification and message event type diagnostic logging to the Chat component to properly handle encrypted messages now that E2EE is fully operational.

BACKGROUND:
With the complete E2EE infrastructure in place:
- B2.2.1: IndexedDBCryptoStore provides persistent key storage
- B2.2.2: initCrypto() initializes crypto in all auth flows (loginAsGuest, login, register)
- B2.2.3: Synapse encryption defaults re-enabled (encryption_enabled_by_default_for_room_type: all)
- B2.3.1: Room creation verified E2EE-compatible with diagnostic logging

Chat messages are now encrypted by default when rooms are created. The Matrix SDK automatically decrypts encrypted messages when the crypto module is initialized, emitting them as EventType.RoomMessage events to the timeline listener.

CHANGES IMPLEMENTED:

1. Added crypto status logging on Chat mount (client/src/components/Chat.jsx:158-165):
   - Logs crypto status when Chat component mounts using client.isCryptoEnabled()
   - Includes cryptoEnabled, roomId, deviceId, and userId for debugging
   - Provides visibility into whether crypto module is initialized when Chat starts
   - Helps diagnose timing issues where Chat might mount before crypto is ready

2. Added message event type diagnostic logging in timeline handler (client/src/components/Chat.jsx:186-194):
   - Logs all timeline events with their type, sender, and eventId
   - Shows whether events are encrypted (m.room.encrypted) or decrypted (m.room.message)
   - Helps diagnose E2EE message flow and decryption issues
   - Moved roomId check before event type filtering to capture all event types

3. Verified existing message handling implementation (client/src/components/Chat.jsx:171-179, 196-205):
   - Timeline listener filters for EventType.RoomMessage (correct - SDK auto-decrypts)
   - Message loading from timeline uses same filter (correct)
   - Matrix SDK handles decryption automatically when crypto is initialized
   - No changes needed to existing event handling logic

4. Verified sendMessage implementation (client/src/components/Chat.jsx:238-241):
   - Uses standard Matrix message format: msgtype: 'm.text', body: trimmed
   - NO explicit encryption parameters (correct - SDK auto-encrypts)
   - Matrix SDK automatically encrypts messages when room has encryption enabled
   - Input clears after successful send (line 243: setInputText(''))

KEY OBSERVATIONS:

1. Message Timeline Handling:
   - Current implementation filters for EventType.RoomMessage
   - Matrix SDK emits m.room.encrypted events when receiving encrypted messages
   - SDK automatically decrypts and re-emits as EventType.RoomMessage
   - Timeline listener correctly handles decrypted messages
   - New diagnostic logging will show both event types for debugging

2. Message Sending:
   - sendMessage() uses standard message format with no encryption config
   - SDK automatically encrypts when room state includes m.room.encryption
   - Synapse sets this state automatically (encryption_enabled_by_default_for_room_type: all)
   - Implementation is correct and E2EE-compatible

3. Crypto Initialization Timing:
   - Crypto initialized in auth flow (B2.2.2) before startClient()
   - By the time Chat mounts, crypto should be ready
   - New diagnostic logging will confirm crypto status on mount
   - Helps identify edge cases where Chat loads before crypto init completes
